tags.name: a

attributes.name: href
attributes.description: The **`href`** attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference [URL](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Content_type#URL). The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

attributes.name: type
attributes.description: The `type` attribute is a generic attribute and it has different meaning based on the context in which it's used.

tags.description: The **<a>** SVG element creates a hyperlink to other web pages, files, locations within the same page, email addresses, or any other URL.

tags.name: audio
tags.description: The **HTML `<audio>` element** is used to embed sound content in documents. It may contain one or more audio sources, represented using the `src` attribute or the [`<source>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/source "The HTML <source> element specifies multiple media resources for the <picture>, the <audio> element, or the <video> element.") element: the browser will choose the most suitable one. It can also be the destination for streamed media, using a [`MediaStream`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MediaStream "The MediaStream interface represents a stream of media content. A stream consists of several tracks such as video or audio tracks. Each track is specified as an instance of MediaStreamTrack.").

tags.name: canvas

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

tags.description: Use the **HTML `<canvas>` element** with either the [canvas scripting API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API) or the [WebGL API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WebGL_API) to draw graphics and animations.

tags.name: circle

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

tags.description: The **`<circle>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element is an SVG basic shape, used to create circles based on a center point and a radius.

tags.name: defs
tags.description: The **`<defs>`** element is used to store graphical objects that will be used at a later time. Objects created inside a `<defs>` element are not rendered directly. To display them you have to reference them (with a [`<use>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/use "The <use> element takes nodes from within the SVG document, and duplicates them somewhere else.") element for example).

tags.name: desc
tags.description: Each container element or graphics element in an SVG drawing can supply a description string using the **`<desc>`** element where the description is text-only.

tags.name: ellipse

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

tags.description: The **`<ellipse>`** element is an SVG basic shape, used to create ellipses based on a center coordinate, and both their x and y radius.

tags.name: foreignObject
tags.description: The **`<foreignObject>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element allows for inclusion of a different XML namespace. In the context of a browser it is most likely XHTML/HTML.

tags.name: g
tags.description: The **`<g>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element is a container used to group other SVG elements.

tags.name: iframe
tags.description: The **HTML Inline Frame element (`<iframe>`)** represents a nested [browsing context](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/browsing_context "browsing context: A browsing context is the environment in which a browser displays a Document (normally a tab nowadays, but possibly also a window or a frame within a page)."), embedding another HTML page into the current one.

tags.name: image

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

tags.description: The **`<image>`** SVG element includes images inside SVG documents. It can display [raster image](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/raster_image "raster image: A raster image is an image file defined as a grid of pixels. They’re also referred to as bitmaps. Common raster image formats on the Web are JPEG, PNG, GIF, and ICO.") files or other SVG files.

tags.name: line

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

attributes.name: x1
attributes.description: The **`x1`** attribute is used to specify the first x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[x](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x)` attribute instead.

attributes.name: y1
attributes.description: The **`y1`** attribute is used to specify the first y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[y](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y)` attribute instead.

attributes.name: x2
attributes.description: The **`x2`** attribute is used to specify the second x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[x](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x)` attribute instead.

attributes.name: y2
attributes.description: The **`y2`** attribute is used to specify the second y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[y](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y)` attribute instead.

tags.description: The **`<line>`** element is an SVG basic shape used to create a line connecting two points.

tags.name: linearGradient

attributes.name: gradientUnits
attributes.description: The `gradientUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system for attributes `[x1](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x1)`, `[y1](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y1)`, `[x2](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x2)` and `[y2](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y2)` on the [`<linearGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/linearGradient "The <linearGradient> SVG element lets authors define linear gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element or for attributes `[cx](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/cx)`, `[cy](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/cy)`, `[r](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/r)`, `[fx](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/fx)`, and `[fy](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/fy)` on the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.").

attributes.name: gradientTransform
attributes.description: The `gradientTransform` attribute contains the definition of an optional additional transformation from the gradient coordinate system onto the target coordinate system (i.e., userSpaceOnUse or objectBoundingBox). This allows for things such as skewing the gradient. This additional transformation matrix is post-multiplied to (i.e., inserted to the right of) any previously defined transformations, including the implicit transformation necessary to convert from object bounding box units to user space.

attributes.name: spreadMethod
attributes.description: The `spreadMethod` attribute applies to gradient paint elements: [linearGradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/linearGradient) and [radialGradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient). It determines how a shape is filled beyond the defined edges of the gradient.

tags.description: The **`<linearGradient>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element lets authors define linear gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.

tags.name: marker

attributes.name: viewBox
attributes.description: The **`viewBox`** attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

attributes.name: refX
attributes.description: The refX attribute is used alongside the refY attribute to provides coordinates for the location on the marker where it will be joined to its markable element. Coordinates are relative to the marker's coordinate system, and not the markable element it is placed on.

attributes.name: markerUnits
attributes.description: The `markerUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system for the attributes `[markerWidth](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/markerWidth)`, `[markerHeight](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/markerHeight)` and the contents of the [`<marker>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker "The <marker> element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given <path>, <line>, <polyline> or <polygon> element.").

attributes.name: markerWidth
attributes.description: The `markerWidth` represents the width of the viewport into which the [`<marker>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker "The <marker> element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given <path>, <line>, <polyline> or <polygon> element.") is to be fitted when it is rendered.

attributes.name: markerHeight
attributes.description: The `markerHeight` represents the height of the viewport into which the [`<marker>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker "The <marker> element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given <path>, <line>, <polyline> or <polygon> element.") is to be fitted when it is rendered.

tags.description: The **`<marker>`** element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given [`<path>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/path "The <path> SVG element is the generic element to define a shape. All the basic shapes can be created with a path element."), [`<line>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/line "The <line> element is an SVG basic shape used to create a line connecting two points."), [`<polyline>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/polyline "The <polyline> SVG element is an SVG basic shape that creates straight lines connecting several points. Typically a polyline is used to create open shapes as the last point doesn't have to be connected to the first point. For closed shapes see the <polygon> element.") or [`<polygon>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/polygon "The <polygon> element defines a closed shape consisting of a set of connected straight line segments. The last point is connected to the first point. For open shapes see the <polyline> element.") element.

tags.name: metadata
tags.description: The **`<metadata>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element allows to add metadata to SVG content. Metadata is structured information about data. The contents of `<metadata>` elements should be elements from other [XML](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/XML "XML: eXtensible Markup Language (XML) is a generic markup language specified by the W3C. The information technology (IT) industry uses many languages based on XML as data-description languages.") [namespaces](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/namespace "namespaces: Namespace is a context for identifiers, a logical grouping of names used in a program. Within the same context and same scope,  an identifier must uniquely identify an entity.") such as [RDF](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/RDF "RDF: RDF (Resource Description Framework) is a language developed by W3C for representing information on the World Wide Web, such as Webpages. RDF provides a standard way of encoding resource information so that it can be exchanged in a fully automated way between applications."), [FOAF](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FOAF_(ontology)), etc.

tags.name: path

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

tags.description: The **`<path>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element is the generic element to define a shape. All the basic shapes can be created with a path element.

tags.name: pattern

attributes.name: viewBox
attributes.description: The **`viewBox`** attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

attributes.name: width
attributes.description: The **`width`** attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

attributes.name: height
attributes.description: The **`height`** attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

attributes.name: patternUnits
attributes.description: The **`patternUnits`** attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the geometry properties of the [`<pattern>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/pattern "The <pattern> element defines a graphics object which can be redrawn at repeated x and y-coordinate intervals ("tiled") to cover an area.") element.

attributes.name: patternContentUnits
attributes.description: The **`patternContentUnits`** attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the contents of the [`<pattern>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/pattern "The <pattern> element defines a graphics object which can be redrawn at repeated x and y-coordinate intervals ("tiled") to cover an area.") element.

attributes.name: patternTransform
attributes.description: The **`patternTransform`** attribute defines a list of [transform definitions](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/transform#Transform_functions) that are applied to a pattern tile.

tags.description: The **`<pattern>`** element defines a graphics object which can be redrawn at repeated x and y-coordinate intervals ("tiled") to cover an area.

tags.name: polygon

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

attributes.name: points
attributes.description: The **`points`** attribute defines a list of points. Each point is defined by a pair of number representing a X and a Y coordinate in the user coordinate system. If the attribute contains an odd number of coordinates, the last one will be ignored.

tags.description: The **`<polygon>`** element defines a closed shape consisting of a set of connected straight line segments. The last point is connected to the first point. For open shapes see the [`<polyline>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/polyline "The <polyline> SVG element is an SVG basic shape that creates straight lines connecting several points. Typically a polyline is used to create open shapes as the last point doesn't have to be connected to the first point. For closed shapes see the <polygon> element.") element.

tags.name: polyline

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

tags.description: The **`<polyline>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element is an SVG basic shape that creates straight lines connecting several points. Typically a `polyline` is used to create open shapes as the last point doesn't have to be connected to the first point. For closed shapes see the [`<polygon>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/polygon "The <polygon> element defines a closed shape consisting of a set of connected straight line segments. The last point is connected to the first point. For open shapes see the <polyline> element.") element.

tags.name: radialGradient

attributes.name: cx
attributes.description: The **`cx`** attribute define the x-axis coordinate of a center point.

attributes.name: cy
attributes.description: The **`cy`** attribute define the y-axis coordinate of a center point.

attributes.name: r
attributes.description: The **`r`** attribute defines the radius of a circle.

attributes.name: fx
attributes.description: For the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element, this attribute define the x-axis coordinate of the focal point for radial gradient. If the attribute is not specified, it's assumed to be at the same place as the center point.

attributes.name: fy
attributes.description: For the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element, this attribute defines the y-axis coordinate of the focal point for the radial gradient. If the attribute is not specified, it's assumed to be at the same place as the center point.

attributes.name: fr
attributes.description: For the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element, this attribute define the radius of the focal point for the radial gradient. If the attribute is not specified, the default value of 0% is used.

tags.description: The **`<radialGradient>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.

tags.name: rect

attributes.name: pathLength
attributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

tags.description: The **`<rect>`** element is a basic SVG shape that creates rectangles, defined by their corner's position, their width, and their height. The rectangles may have their corners rounded.

tags.name: script
tags.description: A SVG `script` element is equivalent to the [`script`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/HTML/Element/Script) element in HTML and thus is the place for scripts (e.g., ECMAScript).

tags.name: stop

attributes.name: offset
attributes.description: The **`offset`** CSS property is a shorthand property for animating an element along a defined path.

tags.description: The **`<stop>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element defines the ramp of colors to use on a gradient, which is a child element to either the [`<linearGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/linearGradient "The <linearGradient> SVG element lets authors define linear gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") or the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element.

tags.name: style

attributes.name: media
attributes.description: REDIRECT [@media \[en-US\]](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media)

tags.description: The **`<style>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element allows style sheets to be embedded directly within SVG content. SVG's `style` element has the same attributes as the corresponding element in HTML (see HTML's [`<style>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/style "The HTML <style> element contains style information for a document, or part of a document.") element).

tags.name: svg

attributes.name: viewBox
attributes.description: The **`viewBox`** attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

attributes.name: transform
attributes.description: The **`transform`** attribute defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children.

tags.description: The `svg` element is a container that defines a new coordinate system and [viewport](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/viewBox). It is used as the outermost element of any SVG document but it can also be used to embed a SVG fragment inside any SVG or HTML document.

tags.name: switch
tags.description: The **`<switch>`** [SVG](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG) element evaluates the `[requiredFeatures](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/requiredFeatures)`, `[requiredExtensions](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/requiredExtensions)` and `[systemLanguage](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/systemLanguage)` attributes on its direct child elements in order, and then processes and renders the first child for which these attributes evaluate to true. All others will be bypassed and therefore not rendered. If the child element is a container element such as a [`<g>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/g "The <g> SVG element is a container used to group other SVG elements."), then the entire subtree is either processed/rendered or bypassed/not rendered.

tags.name: symbol

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

attributes.name: viewBox
attributes.description: The **`viewBox`** attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

tags.description: The **`<symbol>`** element is used to define graphical template objects which can be instantiated by a [`<use>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/use "The <use> element takes nodes from within the SVG document, and duplicates them somewhere else.") element.

tags.name: text

attributes.name: lengthAdjust
attributes.description: When an SVG `<text>`  or `<tspan>` element has a specific length, set using the `textLength` attribute, the `lengthAdjust` attribute controls how the text is stretched or compressed into that length.

tags.description: The SVG **`<text>`** element defines a graphics element consisting of text. It's possible to apply a gradient, pattern, clipping path, mask, or filter to `<text>`, just like any other SVG graphics element.

tags.name: textPath

attributes.name: lengthAdjust
attributes.description: When an SVG `<text>`  or `<tspan>` element has a specific length, set using the `textLength` attribute, the `lengthAdjust` attribute controls how the text is stretched or compressed into that length.

attributes.name: textLength
attributes.description: The `textLength` attribute, available on SVG [`<text>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/text "The SVG <text> element defines a graphics element consisting of text. It's possible to apply a gradient, pattern, clipping path, mask, or filter to <text>, just like any other SVG graphics element.") and [`<tspan>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/tspan "Within a <text> element, text and font properties and the current text position can be adjusted with absolute or relative coordinate values by including a <tspan> element.") elements,  lets you specify the width of the space into which the text will draw. The [user agent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/user_agent "user agent: A user agent is a computer program representing a person, for example, a browser in a Web context.") will ensure that the text does not extend farther than that distance, using the method or methods specified by the `[lengthAdjust](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/lengthAdjust)` attribute. By default, only the spacing between characters is adjusted, but the glyph size can also be adjusted if you change `lengthAdjust`.

tags.description: In addition to text drawn in a straight line, SVG also includes the ability to place text along the shape of a [`<path>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/path "The <path> SVG element is the generic element to define a shape. All the basic shapes can be created with a path element.") element. To specify that a block of text is to be rendered along the shape of a [`<path>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/path "The <path> SVG element is the generic element to define a shape. All the basic shapes can be created with a path element."), include the given text within a **`<textPath>`** element which includes an `[href](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/href)` attribute with a reference to a [`<path>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/path "The <path> SVG element is the generic element to define a shape. All the basic shapes can be created with a path element.") element.

tags.name: title
tags.description: Each container element or graphics element in an SVG drawing can supply a **`<title>`** element containing a description string where the description is text-only. When the current SVG document fragment is rendered as SVG on visual media, `<title>` element is not rendered as part of the graphics. However, some user agents may, for example, display the `<title>` element as a tooltip. Alternate presentations are possible, both visual and aural, which display the `<title>` element but do not display `path` elements or other graphics elements. The `<title>` element generally improves accessibility of SVG documents.

tags.name: tspan

attributes.name: x
attributes.description: The **`x`** attribute defines a x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

attributes.name: y
attributes.description: The **`y`** attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

attributes.name: dx
attributes.description: The **`dx`** attribute indicates a shift along the x-axis on the position of an element or its content.

attributes.name: dy
attributes.description: The **`dy`** attribute indicates a shift along the y-axis on the position of an element or its content.

attributes.name: rotate
attributes.description: The **`rotate`** [CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS) property allows you to specify rotation transforms individually and independantly of the [`transform`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform "The transform CSS property lets you rotate, scale, skew, or translate an element. It modifies the coordinate space of the CSS visual formatting model.") property. This maps better to typical user interface usage, and saves having to remember the exact order of transform functions to specify in the `transform` value.

attributes.name: textLength
attributes.description: The `textLength` attribute, available on SVG [`<text>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/text "The SVG <text> element defines a graphics element consisting of text. It's possible to apply a gradient, pattern, clipping path, mask, or filter to <text>, just like any other SVG graphics element.") and [`<tspan>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/tspan "Within a <text> element, text and font properties and the current text position can be adjusted with absolute or relative coordinate values by including a <tspan> element.") elements,  lets you specify the width of the space into which the text will draw. The [user agent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/user_agent "user agent: A user agent is a computer program representing a person, for example, a browser in a Web context.") will ensure that the text does not extend farther than that distance, using the method or methods specified by the `[lengthAdjust](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/lengthAdjust)` attribute. By default, only the spacing between characters is adjusted, but the glyph size can also be adjusted if you change `lengthAdjust`.

attributes.name: lengthAdjust
attributes.description: When an SVG `<text>`  or `<tspan>` element has a specific length, set using the `textLength` attribute, the `lengthAdjust` attribute controls how the text is stretched or compressed into that length.

tags.description: Within a [`<text>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/text "The SVG <text> element defines a graphics element consisting of text. It's possible to apply a gradient, pattern, clipping path, mask, or filter to <text>, just like any other SVG graphics element.") element, text and font properties and the current text position can be adjusted with absolute or relative coordinate values by including a **`<tspan>`** element.

tags.name: use
tags.description: The **`<use>`** element takes nodes from within the SVG document, and duplicates them somewhere else.

tags.name: video
tags.description: The **HTML Video element** (**`<video>`**) embeds a media player which supports video playback into the document.

tags.name: view

attributes.name: viewBox
attributes.description: The **`viewBox`** attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

attributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
attributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

tags.description: A view is a defined way to view the image, like a zoom level or a detail view.

globalAttributes.name: x
globalAttributes.description: The **`x`** attribute defines a x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

globalAttributes.name: y
globalAttributes.description: The **`y`** attribute defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

globalAttributes.name: dx
globalAttributes.description: The **`dx`** attribute indicates a shift along the x-axis on the position of an element or its content.

globalAttributes.name: dy
globalAttributes.description: The **`dy`** attribute indicates a shift along the y-axis on the position of an element or its content.

globalAttributes.name: rotate
globalAttributes.description: The **`rotate`** [CSS](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS) property allows you to specify rotation transforms individually and independantly of the [`transform`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transform "The transform CSS property lets you rotate, scale, skew, or translate an element. It modifies the coordinate space of the CSS visual formatting model.") property. This maps better to typical user interface usage, and saves having to remember the exact order of transform functions to specify in the `transform` value.

globalAttributes.name: textLength
globalAttributes.description: The `textLength` attribute, available on SVG [`<text>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/text "The SVG <text> element defines a graphics element consisting of text. It's possible to apply a gradient, pattern, clipping path, mask, or filter to <text>, just like any other SVG graphics element.") and [`<tspan>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/tspan "Within a <text> element, text and font properties and the current text position can be adjusted with absolute or relative coordinate values by including a <tspan> element.") elements,  lets you specify the width of the space into which the text will draw. The [user agent](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Glossary/user_agent "user agent: A user agent is a computer program representing a person, for example, a browser in a Web context.") will ensure that the text does not extend farther than that distance, using the method or methods specified by the `[lengthAdjust](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/lengthAdjust)` attribute. By default, only the spacing between characters is adjusted, but the glyph size can also be adjusted if you change `lengthAdjust`.

globalAttributes.name: lengthAdjust
globalAttributes.description: When an SVG `<text>`  or `<tspan>` element has a specific length, set using the `textLength` attribute, the `lengthAdjust` attribute controls how the text is stretched or compressed into that length.

globalAttributes.name: viewBox
globalAttributes.description: The **`viewBox`** attribute defines the position and dimension, in user space, of an SVG viewport.

globalAttributes.name: preserveAspectRatio
globalAttributes.description: The **`preserveAspectRatio`** attribute indicates how an element with a viewBox providing a given aspect ratio must fit into a viewport with a different aspect ratio.

globalAttributes.name: pathLength
globalAttributes.description: The **`pathLength`** attribute lets authors specify a total length for the path, in user units. This value is then used to calibrate the browser's distance calculations with those of the author, by scaling all distance computations using the ratio `pathLength`/(_computed value of path length_).

globalAttributes.name: href
globalAttributes.description: The **`href`** attribute defines a link to a resource as a reference [URL](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Content_type#URL). The exact meaning of that link depends on the context of each element using it.

globalAttributes.name: type
globalAttributes.description: The `type` attribute is a generic attribute and it has different meaning based on the context in which it's used.

globalAttributes.name: x1
globalAttributes.description: The **`x1`** attribute is used to specify the first x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[x](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x)` attribute instead.

globalAttributes.name: y1
globalAttributes.description: The **`y1`** attribute is used to specify the first y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[y](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y)` attribute instead.

globalAttributes.name: x2
globalAttributes.description: The **`x2`** attribute is used to specify the second x-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[x](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x)` attribute instead.

globalAttributes.name: y2
globalAttributes.description: The **`y2`** attribute is used to specify the second y-coordinate for drawing an SVG element that requires more than one coordinate. Elements that only need one coordinate use the `[y](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y)` attribute instead.

globalAttributes.name: gradientUnits
globalAttributes.description: The `gradientUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system for attributes `[x1](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x1)`, `[y1](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y1)`, `[x2](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/x2)` and `[y2](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/y2)` on the [`<linearGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/linearGradient "The <linearGradient> SVG element lets authors define linear gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element or for attributes `[cx](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/cx)`, `[cy](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/cy)`, `[r](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/r)`, `[fx](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/fx)`, and `[fy](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/fy)` on the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.").

globalAttributes.name: gradientTransform
globalAttributes.description: The `gradientTransform` attribute contains the definition of an optional additional transformation from the gradient coordinate system onto the target coordinate system (i.e., userSpaceOnUse or objectBoundingBox). This allows for things such as skewing the gradient. This additional transformation matrix is post-multiplied to (i.e., inserted to the right of) any previously defined transformations, including the implicit transformation necessary to convert from object bounding box units to user space.

globalAttributes.name: spreadMethod
globalAttributes.description: The `spreadMethod` attribute applies to gradient paint elements: [linearGradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/linearGradient) and [radialGradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient). It determines how a shape is filled beyond the defined edges of the gradient.

globalAttributes.name: refX
globalAttributes.description: The refX attribute is used alongside the refY attribute to provides coordinates for the location on the marker where it will be joined to its markable element. Coordinates are relative to the marker's coordinate system, and not the markable element it is placed on.

globalAttributes.name: markerUnits
globalAttributes.description: The `markerUnits` attribute defines the coordinate system for the attributes `[markerWidth](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/markerWidth)`, `[markerHeight](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/markerHeight)` and the contents of the [`<marker>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker "The <marker> element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given <path>, <line>, <polyline> or <polygon> element.").

globalAttributes.name: markerWidth
globalAttributes.description: The `markerWidth` represents the width of the viewport into which the [`<marker>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker "The <marker> element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given <path>, <line>, <polyline> or <polygon> element.") is to be fitted when it is rendered.

globalAttributes.name: markerHeight
globalAttributes.description: The `markerHeight` represents the height of the viewport into which the [`<marker>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/marker "The <marker> element defines the graphic that is to be used for drawing arrowheads or polymarkers on a given <path>, <line>, <polyline> or <polygon> element.") is to be fitted when it is rendered.

globalAttributes.name: width
globalAttributes.description: The **`width`** attribute defines the horizontal length of an element in the user coordinate system.

globalAttributes.name: height
globalAttributes.description: The **`height`** attribute defines the vertical length of an element in the user coordinate system.

globalAttributes.name: patternUnits
globalAttributes.description: The **`patternUnits`** attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the geometry properties of the [`<pattern>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/pattern "The <pattern> element defines a graphics object which can be redrawn at repeated x and y-coordinate intervals ("tiled") to cover an area.") element.

globalAttributes.name: patternContentUnits
globalAttributes.description: The **`patternContentUnits`** attribute indicates which coordinate system to use for the contents of the [`<pattern>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/pattern "The <pattern> element defines a graphics object which can be redrawn at repeated x and y-coordinate intervals ("tiled") to cover an area.") element.

globalAttributes.name: patternTransform
globalAttributes.description: The **`patternTransform`** attribute defines a list of [transform definitions](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Attribute/transform#Transform_functions) that are applied to a pattern tile.

globalAttributes.name: points
globalAttributes.description: The **`points`** attribute defines a list of points. Each point is defined by a pair of number representing a X and a Y coordinate in the user coordinate system. If the attribute contains an odd number of coordinates, the last one will be ignored.

globalAttributes.name: cx
globalAttributes.description: The **`cx`** attribute define the x-axis coordinate of a center point.

globalAttributes.name: cy
globalAttributes.description: The **`cy`** attribute define the y-axis coordinate of a center point.

globalAttributes.name: r
globalAttributes.description: The **`r`** attribute defines the radius of a circle.

globalAttributes.name: fx
globalAttributes.description: For the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element, this attribute define the x-axis coordinate of the focal point for radial gradient. If the attribute is not specified, it's assumed to be at the same place as the center point.

globalAttributes.name: fy
globalAttributes.description: For the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element, this attribute defines the y-axis coordinate of the focal point for the radial gradient. If the attribute is not specified, it's assumed to be at the same place as the center point.

globalAttributes.name: fr
globalAttributes.description: For the [`<radialGradient>`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/SVG/Element/radialGradient "The <radialGradient> SVG element lets authors define radial gradients to fill or stroke graphical elements.") element, this attribute define the radius of the focal point for the radial gradient. If the attribute is not specified, the default value of 0% is used.

globalAttributes.name: offset
globalAttributes.description: The **`offset`** CSS property is a shorthand property for animating an element along a defined path.

globalAttributes.name: media
globalAttributes.description: REDIRECT [@media \[en-US\]](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/@media)

globalAttributes.name: transform
globalAttributes.description: The **`transform`** attribute defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children.
